title: Testament Records (United States)
text:
Testament Records was an American <a href="independent%20record%20label">independent record label</a> based in <a href="Philadelphia">Philadelphia</a>, later <a href="Chicago">Chicago</a>, then <a href="Pasadena%2C%20California">Pasadena</a>. Founded in 1963 by "<a href="Down%20Beat">Down Beat</a>" magazine editor and writer <a href="Pete%20Welding">Pete Welding</a>, the label specialized in <a href="American%20roots%20music">American roots music</a>, releasing some thirty LPs — mainly <a href="blues">blues</a>, but also <a href="gospel%20music">gospel</a>, <a href="Country%20music">country</a> and <a href="jazz">jazz</a> albums until 1977.
Artists recording for the label included <a href="David%20%26quot%3BHoneyboy%26quot%3B%20Edwards">David "Honeyboy" Edwards</a>, <a href="Sleepy%20John%20Estes">Sleepy John Estes</a>, <a href="J.B.%20Hutto">J.B. Hutto</a>, <a href="Floyd%20Jones">Floyd Jones</a>, <a href="Mississippi%20Fred%20McDowell">Mississippi Fred McDowell</a>, <a href="Robert%20Nighthawk">Robert Nighthawk</a>, <a href="Doctor%20Ross">Doctor Ross</a>, <a href="Johnny%20Shines">Johnny Shines</a>, <a href="Otis%20Spann">Otis Spann</a>, <a href="Eddie%20Taylor">Eddie Taylor</a>, <a href="Big%20Joe%20Williams">Big Joe Williams</a>, <a href="Johnny%20%26quot%3BMan%26quot%3B%20Young">Johnny "Man" Young</a>, and the <a href="Piedmont%20blues">Piedmont blues</a>man <a href="Carl%20Martin%20%28musician%29">Carl Martin</a>, who recorded for Testament in the mid-1960s, after having been inactive as a musician for many years. Testament also released important compilations, such as a collection of topical songs on the death of President John F. Kennedy, and also a collection of historic and contemporary fife and drum band recordings.
In 1994, the Testament catalog was acquired by <a href="Hightone%20Records">Hightone Records</a>, which reissued almost all the Testament albums on CD, adding previously unissued bonus tracks where available.
